div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 08:55 am CDT

div.span: A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly between 11am and 5pm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 63. North northeast wind 11 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
Partly cloudy, with a low around 42. North wind 5 to 13 mph becoming west northwest after midnight.

A slight chance of showers, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms after 1pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 63. Northwest wind 7 to 11 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

div.p: Randolph High School will be hosting Driver's Ed again this year through Northeast Community College. Individuals need to be 14-17 years old and must have a LPE, SCP, or LPD. The cost for the course is $295 which includes a book. Randolph Public Schools will pay $95 for each Randolph Public Schools student who registers for the course. A parent meeting is scheduled via zoom on May 7th at 6:30 pm. The zoom . . .

h3.a: Important Dates for the Jr/Sr High

div.p:
May 1st - Virtual Awards Ceremony for Randolph High School Students. Links will be emailed to students and will be posted on the School Website and other school sponsored social media.
May 9th - Diploma Pickup and Virtual Scholarship Announcements for the 2020 Graduates. The Diploma Pickup will be at the school but due to restrictions placed on the school this will not be an event open to the . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Important Dates for the Jr/Sr High

div.p: On Monday, March 23rd, we will begin providing breakfast and lunch meals to all students who request one at no cost to the student or family. Any person 18 or younger living in the same household as students enrolled at RPS can also receive meals at no cost. As of right now, meals will be provided each weekday with the exception of April 10th and April 13th. Please, either call Randolph High School or . . .
